title: Meta Fined €91 Million for Storing Millions of Facebook and Instagram Passwords in Plaintext
description: The Irish Data Protection Commission (DPC) has fined Meta €91 million ($101.56 million) as part of a probe into a security lapse in March 2019, when the company disclosed that it had mistakenly stored users' passwords in plaintext in its systems.
